messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] SHIGEHARU - STUDENT OF TOSHINAGA II
messages.msgSnippet: G day Gordon, Thanks very much for your trouble. Regards, Barry. ... From: Gordon Robson To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Tuesday, June 05, 2007 7:24 AM
messages.messageBody:
G'day Gordon,
Thanks very much for your trouble.
Regards,
Barry.

----- Original Message -----
From: Gordon Robson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 05, 2007 7:24 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] SHIGEHARU - STUDENT OF TOSHINAGA II


Hi Barry,

The Kinko Jiten lists 8 Shigeharus. Only one is said to use a two
character signature and there is only the information that he is late
Edo period.

Gordon

On Jun 4, 2007, at 11:00 PM, Barry Thomas wrote:

> Gordon and all,
>
> I've put three images of the Shigeharu in my "Barry Thomas" photo
> album - the fuchi, kashira and mei. I'd be grateful for any and all
> information.
>
> Thanks,
> Barry

.

Barry.

messages.subject: Re: SHIGEHARU - STUDENT OF TOSHINAGA II
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Barry, from R E Haynes index of sword fittings. SHIGEHARU (H08222.0) Nara, hisname was JUBEI, he worked in Kando in Edo. Died 1775 Seems to have lived to
messages.messageBody:
Hey Barry, from R E Haynes index of sword fittings.

SHIGEHARU (H08222.0)

Nara, hisname was JUBEI, he worked in Kando in Edo. Died 1775

Seems to have lived to the age of 70. Student of Nara Toshinaga

That's all except for a listing in the Mosel collection. (page 287 Item 920)

I will try and dig up a meifor you tomorrow and email it over mate.

Rich

messages.subject: SHIGEHARU - STUDENT OF TOSHINAGA II
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, A friend of mine has a lovely fuchigashira by Shigeharu.  I m a blade man and don t have so many fittings books, certainly not the bibles , so I
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,

A friend of mine has a lovely fuchigashira by Shigeharu. I'm a blade man and don't have so many fittings books, certainly not the "bibles", so I have trawled the web looking for info on Shigeharu and have found nothing so far. Does anyone have any info on this artisan that they could post on the list??

With thanks,

Barry Thomas
(Melbourne, Australia)

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
